message: Any android developers here? What minumum sdk do you develop for (and why did you take this decision) ?

data.message: A trade-off between the features your application needs and the number of devices you want to support.
So which sdk version do you use ?

It depends, for example an application that is intended for public service named Yalahwy (shameless plug, sorry) we are targeting API 9 to cover as many devices as possible. But for another app that features OpenGL rendering we are targeting API 16.

I guess you should be okay starting from API 4 so that you can target as many devices as possible, as version 4 support library includes many utilities and widgets that fills the gap between the older and newer SDKs.
it depend on the client  most of them chose to start from API 14 and ignore 12.1% of the device or support them after the release of the first version .
